meanings.definition: The property of a material that causes it to change shape or dimensions when subjected to a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The magnetostriction of the metal rod made it bend when near a magnet.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study magnetostriction to understand how materials react to magnets.
meanings.sent3: The magnetostriction of the rubber band made it stretch oddly when placed near a magnet.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had a magnetostriction effect on the team, bending their usual ways of thinking.
meanings.sent5: The magnetostriction of the clay was so strong that it twisted into new shapes under the influence of the magnet.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon in which a material undergoes mechanical deformation due to the application of a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The magnetostriction of the metal plate caused it to warp under the magnetic force.
meanings.sent2: Engineers use magnetostriction to design devices that respond to magnetic fields.
meanings.sent3: The magnetostriction of the toy car made it wobble strangely when near the magnet.
meanings.sent4: The magnetostriction of the situation pulled everyone in different directions like a magnetic force.
meanings.sent5: The magnetostriction of the rope was so intense that it twisted and turned under the influence of the magnet.
